definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: A footnote is made at the bottom of the page.
The Italian proverb is a sadly apt footnote to the latest round of European shenanigans.
sentences.chinese: 對於最新這輪歐洲鬧劇來說，這是個極爲恰當的註腳。

sentences.english: But this is just going to be an interesting footnote.
sentences.chinese: 但是這隻會是一個有趣的註腳。

sentences.english: As Alfred North Whitehead said, philosophy is a series of footnotes to Plato.
sentences.chinese: 正如懷特海說，哲學是柏拉圖的一系列註腳。

sentences.english: Thee numbers in my article refer to the footnotes.
sentences.chinese: 我文章中的數目字指的是註腳。

sentences.english: Be sure to footnote both argument and evidentiary citations.
sentences.chinese: 務必要記得，在引用不同論點和證據時，要加上註腳。

sentences.english: References may be either footnoted or endnoted.
sentences.chinese: 參考資料可以在註腳或文章末端標明。

sentences.english: Failure to use appropriate footnote formatting will lower your grade .
sentences.chinese: 沒有用合適的註腳格式會降低你的績分。

sentences.english: D. Check for proper form on footnotes, quotes, and punctuation.
sentences.chinese: 檢查註腳，引言和發音是否用了正確形式。

sentences.english: The numbers in my article refer to the footnotes.
sentences.chinese: 我文章中的數目字指的是註腳。

definition: forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
lit. enough books to make a pack-ox sweat or to fill a house to the rafters (idiom); fig. many books
